title: P01-1056

sentences.text: Techniques for automatically training modules of a natural language generator have recently been proposed , but a fundamental concern is whether the quality of utterances produced with trainable components can compete with hand-crafted template-based or rule-based approaches .
In this paper We experimentally evaluate a trainable sentence planner for a spoken dialogue system by eliciting subjective human judgments .
In order to perform an exhaustive comparison , we also evaluate a hand-crafted template-based generation component , two rule-based sentence planners , and two baseline sentence planners .
We show that the trainable sentence planner performs better than the rule-based systems and the baselines , and as well as the hand-crafted system .

Entity-we_experimentally_evaluate_a_trai.label: We experimentally evaluate a trainable sentence planner for a spoken dialogue system by eliciting subjective human judgments
aliases: We experimentally evaluate a trainable sentence planner for a spoken dialogue system by eliciting subjective human judgments
Entity-we_experimentally_evaluate_a_trai.description: The research study that evaluates the performance of a trainable sentence planner in a spoken dialogue system through subjective human judgments.

mentions.local_name: We experimentally evaluate a trainable sentence planner for a spoken dialogue system by eliciting subjective human judgments

Entity-in_this_paper.label: In this paper
Entity-in_this_paper.description: This paper describes the experimental evaluation of a trainable sentence planner for a spoken dialogue system, including comparisons with hand-crafted and rule-based approaches.

Entity-trainable_sentence_planner.label: trainable sentence planner
Entity-trainable_sentence_planner.description: A natural language processing tool or algorithm that can automatically generate sentences for a spoken dialogue system through training.

Entity-a_trainable_sentence_planner_for_.label: a trainable sentence planner for a spoken dialogue system
aliases: a trainable sentence planner for a spoken dialogue system
Entity-a_trainable_sentence_planner_for_.description: A software component that generates sentences based on input and can be trained to improve its performance.

mentions.local_name: a trainable sentence planner for a spoken dialogue system

Entity-rule-based_sentence_planner.label: rule-based sentence planners
Entity-rule-based_sentence_planner.description: Systems or algorithms that use predefined rules to generate sentences.

Entity-hand-crafted_template-based_or_ru.label: hand-crafted template-based or rule-based approaches
Entity-hand-crafted_template-based_or_ru.description: Methods that involve manually designing and constructing templates or rules to generate natural language, as opposed to using automated training processes.

Entity-baseline_sentence_planner.label: baseline sentence planners
Entity-baseline_sentence_planner.description: Two systems or algorithms used as reference points for evaluating the performance of trainable sentence planners.

aliases: Techniques for automatically training modules of a natural language generator
Entity-technique_for_automatically_train.description: Methods and strategies developed to train components within a system capable of generating human-like natural language, without manual intervention.

Entity-a_hand-crafted_template-based_gen.description: A manually designed module that uses pre-defined templates to generate natural language outputs.

Entity-utterance.label: utterances
Entity-utterance.description: The output text produced by natural language generators, either automatically trained or hand-crafted.

Entity-hand-crafted_template-based_gener.label: hand-crafted template-based generation component
Entity-hand-crafted_template-based_gener.description: A manual creation-based method for generating text using pre-defined templates

Entity-two_baseline_sentence_planner.description: Two types of sentence planning approaches used as baselines for comparison purposes.

Entity-trainable_component.description: A set of modules that can be trained to perform specific tasks, allowing their behavior and output to be adjusted through learning.

Entity-natural_language_generator.label: natural language generator
Entity-natural_language_generator.description: A system that automatically generates natural language text.

Entity-spoken_dialogue_system.label: spoken dialogue system
Entity-spoken_dialogue_system.description: A technology that enables natural language conversations between humans and computers.

Entity-rule-based_system.label: rule-based systems
Entity-rule-based_system.description: A type of artificial intelligence or computer science approach that relies on predefined rules to generate outputs or make decisions.

Entity-hand-crafted_system.label: hand-crafted system
Entity-hand-crafted_system.description: A manually designed or created computational method

Entity-subjective_human_judgment.description: Individual opinions or assessments made by people

Entity-baseline.label: baselines
Entity-baseline.description: Standard or expected levels of performance for comparison purposes

Entity-paper.label: paper
Entity-paper.description: A written work that presents research or information on a particular topic, often published and disseminated to others.

summary: Techniques for automatically training modules of a natural language generator have recently been proposed , but a fundamental concern is whether the quality of utterances produced with trainable components can compete with hand-crafted template-based or rule-based approaches . In this paper We experimentally evaluate a trainable sentence planner for a spoken dialogue system by eliciting subjective human judgments . In order to perform an exhaustive comparison , we also evaluate a hand-crafted template-based generation component , two rule-based sentence planners , and two baseline sentence planners . We show that the trainable sentence planner performs better than the rule-based systems and the baselines , and as well as the hand-crafted system .

Predicate-experimentally_evaluate.label: experimentally evaluate
Predicate-experimentally_evaluate.description: To experimentally evaluate means to systematically test and assess the effectiveness or performance of something (the object), typically using empirical methods, with the goal of drawing conclusions about its validity, reliability, or potential applications. This predicate connects a subject (e.g., paper) that presents an idea, concept, or solution with the process of testing and evaluating it in real-world scenarios.

Predicate-elicits.label: elicits
Predicate-elicits.description: The predicate 'elicits' indicates that the subject (an action or process) causes or brings forth a response or reaction from the object (a person, group of people, or entity), which can be subjective, objective, or both. In general, it implies an interaction between the subject and the object where the subject stimulates or prompts the object to produce some kind of output.

Predicate-performs_better_than.label: performs better than
Predicate-performs_better_than.description: The predicate 'performs better than' indicates that the subject has superior performance or effectiveness compared to the object. It implies a competitive relationship between the two entities, suggesting that the subject outshines or surpasses the object in terms of quality, efficiency, or achievement.

Predicate-performs_as_well_as.label: performs as well as
Predicate-performs_as_well_as.description: The predicate 'performs as well as' indicates that the subject and object are comparable entities with respect to their performance or effectiveness. It suggests a neutral evaluation, implying that both the subject and object have similar qualities or abilities, without necessarily implying superiority or inferiority.

Predicate-describe.label: describe
Predicate-describe.description: To characterize or outline the essential features of something, typically providing an overview or summary that captures its key aspects.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: Indicates that the subject has a more general or overarching concept, category, or classification to which it belongs.
